channel.title: BBC News - Home
channel.description: The latest stories from the Home section of the BBC News web site.
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Secretly-filmed MPs deny wrongdoing
item.description: Ex-Foreign Secretaries Jack Straw and Sir Malcolm Rifkind say they have broken no rules after being secretly filmed apparently offering their services to a private company for thousands of pounds.

item.title: Birdman, Redmayne, Moore lead Oscars
item.description: British actor Eddie Redmayne wins best actor at this year's Oscars, while Julianne Moore is named best actress and Birdman best picture.

item.title: HSBC reports sharp fall in profits
item.description: HSBC has said 2014 was a "challenging year" after reporting a 17% drop in profit to $18.7bn, with chief executive Stuart Gulliver seeing his pay drop.

item.title: Egypt jails activist for five years
item.description: An Egyptian court jails Alaa Abdel Fattah, a key figure in the 2011 uprising, for five years at a retrial for breaking protest laws.

item.title: Cameron in pensioner benefits pledge
item.description: Universal benefits for pensioners will once again be protected if the Conservatives win May's general election, David Cameron will say later.

item.title: UK police in Turkey for Syria girls
item.description: British police officers are in Turkey as the search continues for three schoolgirls believed to be heading for Syria to join Islamic State militants.

item.title: Some Church jobs below living wage
item.description: The Church of England pays some staff less than the living wage - despite calling on employers to pay at least that amount - the Sun newspaper reveals.

item.title: Deadline looms for Greek reform plan
item.description: Greece is preparing to present a list of reforms to international creditors in order to secure a bailout extension.

item.title: Deaths in detention 'avoidable'
item.description: The deaths of hundreds of people with mental health conditions who were held in detention could have been avoided, an inquiry in England and Wales finds.

item.title: Abbott to target domestic extremists
item.description: Australian PM Tony Abbott announces a push to toughen citizenship laws and tackle those inciting hatred in a bid to target domestic extremists.

item.title: Australia strips Harris of honours
item.description: Rolf Harris is stripped of his Australian honours after his conviction last year for child sex offences, a formal statement says.

item.title: Barry George in compensation protest
item.description: Barry George, the man wrongfully convicted of the murder of TV presenter Jill Dando, tells the BBC that a decision not to award him compensation is "a mockery of justice".

item.title: 'Cash for access' and Church low pay - papers
item.description: Matters of pay and wealth make headlines, with MPs facing questions over 'cash for access' claims, Church of England pay under scrutiny and more on HSBC's Swiss arm.

item.title: Is Nato looking the right way?
item.description: As crises unfold on Europe's eastern and southern flanks, diplomatic correspondent Jonathan Marcus asks if strategic vision is lacking to deal with them.

item.title: Selling Scotland the Rebrand
item.description: A "refreshed" Scottish economic strategy next month will highlight inequality and science. It's getting some advice this week on what to put in the chapter about boosting exports.

item.title: VIDEO: The art the UK forgets to love
item.description: The BBC's Will Gompertz asks whether the UK is falling out of love with art.

item.title: DSK's bizarre pimping trial
item.description: Dominique Strauss-Kahn's trial was a bizarre affair that ended in a call for his acquittal. But the entire case has never been straightforward, says the BBC's Hugh Schofield.

item.title: Long slow road to university access
item.description: University of Bolton assistant vice-chancellor Patrick McGhee looks at how access for poorer students varies regionally and what is being done.

item.title: Why is Suleyman Shah's tomb so important?
item.description: After scores of Turkish troops and vehicles enter Syria to evacuate and destroy a mausoleum where the forefather of the Ottoman empire was buried, the BBC's Matthew Davis considers why the site was so important.

item.title: Academy Awards A to Z
item.description: With the 87th Awards fast approaching, here is our A to Z guide to the biggest night of the movie calendar.

item.title: VIDEO: India budget preview - in 90 seconds
item.description: What is likely to be announced in Indian Prime Minister Modi's first full budget?

item.title: Alonso faces further hospital tests
item.description: Fernando Alonso will have further tests on Monday before doctors decide whether to release him from hospital.

item.title: Chelsea fan sorry over Paris incident
item.description: An ex-police officer and Chelsea fan apologises for his part in an alleged racist incident on the Paris Metro - but denies he is a racist.

item.title: England must 'stay together' - Moeen
item.description: England must ignore the negativity and stick together after their win against Scotland, says Moeen Ali.

item.title: VIDEO: MOTD3: Gallagher on 'whinger' Mourinho
item.description: Former Oasis star Noel Gallagher delivers a stinging assessment of Jose Mourinho during this week's Match of the Day 3, claiming the Chelsea boss is having a "breakdown."

item.title: Edwards eyes 200th game as captain
item.description: England legend Charlotte Edwards says she is "hugely proud" to captain her country for the 200th time.

item.title: Real wages to rise in 2015, says EY
item.description: UK workers are set to see their real pay rise this year for the first time since 2007, according to a report from the EY Item Club.

item.title: Bovis Homes' full-year profits jump
item.description: Housebuilder Bovis Homes reports a big rise in profits to £133.5m after an "excellent" year, with house sales at a record high.

item.title: Lords raise voting age concerns
item.description: A House of Lords committee criticises the plan to transfer power from Westminster to Holyrood to enable 16 and 17-year-olds to vote.

item.title: New tax evasion crime proposed
item.description: Companies that fail to prevent tax evasion could face penalties as part of a plan announced by Lib Dem Chief Secretary to the Treasury Danny Alexander.

item.title: Call for global single-use syringes
item.description: Smart syringes that can be used only once should be used for injections, the World Health Organization has announced.

item.title: NHS foundation trusts deficit rises
item.description: NHS foundation trusts are £321m in deficit, as the use of expensive agency staff is having a drastic impact on budgets, says the health regulator Monitor.

item.title: Domestic abuse school lessons row
item.description: A woman who was shot by her estranged husband wants a law passed saying domestic violence issues will be taught in schools.

item.title: Sturgeon to visit top London school
item.description: First Minister Nicola Sturgeon says Scotland can learn lessons from schools in England ahead of a visit to a high achieving London junior school.

item.title: Lenovo offers fix for hidden adware
item.description: Chinese computer maker Lenovo offers free software so users can remove hidden software that experts warned made them vulnerable to a cyber-attack.

item.title: US and UK 'hacked Sim card firm'
item.description: US and British spies hacked a top Sim card firm to steal security codes and facilitate eavesdropping on mobiles, a news website says.

item.title: Black hole's blast stunts stars
item.description: The winds blasted out by supermassive black holes at the centre of galaxies are strong enough to slow the birth of new stars, astronomers reveal.

item.title: Google-backed genetic test approved
item.description: A Californian start-up will be allowed to advertise a mail order DNA test that screens for a rare genetic condition.

item.title: Christian comedy wins four Razzies
item.description: Saving Christmas, Kirk Cameron's comedy about the true meaning of the festival, is the big winner at the annual celebration of movie mediocrity, the Razzies.

item.title: Birdman wins Independent Spirit
item.description: Birdman beats Boyhood to the top prize at the Independent Spirit awards, a day before the films go up against each other at the Oscars.

item.title: Why homeless Britons are turning to the Sikh community for food
item.description: Homeless people in the UK are getting free meals thanks to a centuries-old Sikh tradition. Why, asks Rajeev Gupta.

item.title: Weekendish: The best of the week's reads
item.description: A collection of some of the best reads from the BBC News website this week.

item.title: Abbey funeral for tipper truck girl
item.description: The funeral of a four-year-old girl killed in a tipper truck crash is to be held at Bath Abbey later.

item.title: Police officer 'saves baby's life'
item.description: A police officer investigating a burglary saves a baby's life after hearing the girl's mother screaming.

item.title: Fertility clinic at hospital reopens
item.description: A scandal-hit fertility clinic based at Glasgow Royal Infirmary is reopening after a £4m refurbishment was carried out.

item.title: Warnings issued for hail and sleet
item.description: Weather forecasters warn of hazardous driving conditions on Monday and Tuesday as sleet, snow and hail showers sweep across Scotland.

item.title: Derry woman critical in Indonesia
item.description: A 22-year-old woman from Londonderry is in a critical condition in an Indonesian hospital after collapsing while on holiday.

item.title: 13-year-old girl killed in crash
item.description: A 13-year-old girl from County Donegal dies following a crash on the Glenshane Road in Londonderry.

item.title: Search to resume for missing boy, 11
item.description: The seventh day of searching for schoolboy Cameron Comey gets underway on Monday morning.

item.title: Airlift operation for hilltop path
item.description: An operation to airlift hundreds of tonnes of heather brash and crushed stone to repair a hilltop walking route begins on Monday.

item.title: BBC chooses Kenya innovators for pilot
item.description: Two groups of Kenyan tech innovators are selected to help the BBC reach young African audiences through social and digital platforms.

item.title: Army retakes town from Boko Haram
item.description: The Nigerian army says it has retaken the town of Baga, held by Boko Haram militants since 3 January.

item.title: Thais jailed for king insult in play
item.description: A Thai man and woman are each jailed for more than two years for breaking strict laws against insulting the monarchy in a 2013 student play.

item.title: N Korea bans foreigners from race
item.description: North Korean authorities ban foreigners from the annual Pyongyang marathon because of concerns over the spread of the Ebola virus, travel agencies say.

item.title: Ukraine 'cannot start withdrawal'
item.description: The Ukrainian military says it cannot start withdrawing heavy weapons from the front line in the east until the rebels stop shelling its positions.

item.title: Hungary's PM loses 'super-majority'
item.description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban loses the two-thirds majority that allowed him to pass a new constitution without opposition support.,

item.title: Cuba frees Canadian businessman
item.description: Cuba frees the president of a Canadian transport company, Cy Tokmakjian, after more than three years in jail on bribery charges.

item.title: 'Coup plot' charge for Caracas mayor
item.description: Caracas Mayor Antonio Ledezma is indicted for plotting violence against Venezuela's government - a move condemned by the opposition.

item.title: Egypt's top cleric calls for reform
item.description: The Grand Sheikh of Egypt's al-Azhar University calls for overhaul of Islamic religious teaching to tackle spread of extremism.

item.title: Turkey enters Syria to remove tomb
item.description: Turkish forces enter war-torn northern Syria to evacuate troops guarding a historic tomb, demolishing it and moving the remains elsewhere.

item.title: Shopping mall terror threat 'serious'
item.description: The head of US homeland security urges vigilance after Somali-based militants call for attacks on shopping centres in the US, Canada and Britain.

item.title: New York event remembers Malcolm X
item.description: A ceremony is held in New York's Harlem to honour black civil rights leader Malcolm X at the site where he was assassinated 50 years ago.

item.title: Week in pictures: 14-20 February 2015
item.description: News photos from around the world

item.title: Day in pictures: 20 February 2015
item.description: Images from around the world: 20 February

item.title: Rare snowstorm blankets Middle East
item.description: Rare blizzards bring snow to Middle East

item.title: Your pictures: Black and white
item.description: Readers' photographs on the theme of black and white

item.title: Historic photos of Shrovetide scrum
item.description: Ashbourne's Shrovetide football game down the ages

item.title: Day in pictures: 19 February 2015
item.description: Images from around the world: 19 February

item.title: Natural beauty captured in winning images
item.description: Winning garden images from across the world

item.title: In pictures: Rio samba schools fight for title
item.description: Carnival battle in Rio

item.title: VIDEO: Home Affairs Committee
item.description: MPs take evidence from the new head of an inquiry into allegations of historic child abuse.

item.title: VIDEO: Oscars 2015: The best bits
item.description: BBC News looks back at some of the highlights of the 2015 Academy Awards ceremony.

item.title: VIDEO: Tackling FGM's poor prosecution rate
item.description: BBC Inside Out investigates why there have been no successful prosecutions for female genital mutilation even though it has been a criminal offence in Britain for 30 years.

item.title: VIDEO: Jerusalem mayor 'stops attacker'
item.description: The mayor of Jerusalem, Nir Barkat, says he and his security guard fought off a Palestinian man near the town hall on Sunday after an ultra-Orthodox Jew was stabbed with a knife at a busy crossroads.

item.title: VIDEO: Moment deadly blast hits Ukraine march
item.description: A bomb has killed at least two people, including a police officer, and injured 10 other people at a rally in Ukraine's second city Kharkiv.

item.title: VIDEO: Cumberbatch: 'No losers' at Oscars
item.description: Benedict Cumberbatch says that the Oscars are "fantastic" despite missing out on the best actor trophy.

item.title: VIDEO: Inside London Fashion Week
item.description: Do high end catwalk shows have any bearing on high street fashion?

item.title: VIDEO: 'Syria' girl's sister: She's our baby
item.description: Renu Begum, the sister of one of the three girls who are believed to have fled to Syria to join Islamic State,, urges her to come home, saying she is "our baby".

item.title: VIDEO: Icy truck slide starts chain reaction
item.description: A pickup truck was caught on video sliding down an icy road in and crashing into another car.

item.title: Oscars 2015: The ceremony in pictures
item.description: Images of the ceremony and backstage on Oscars night

item.title: Why I regret my years as a tanning addict
item.description: 'Why I regret my years as a suntan addict'

item.title: Healthy dose of hope for one-use syringes
item.description: Could new "auto-disable" syringe help stem outbreaks of HIV?

item.title: The blind breast cancer detectors
item.description: The blind breast cancer detectors who find 2mm tumours

item.title: VIDEO: Pinball paradise at the heart of Europe
item.description: The pinball paradise that draws people from all over Europe

item.title: Coming out as gay at Chinese New Year
item.description: 100 million watch daring Chinese New Year video

item.title: Kibera gets a revamp
item.description: Africa's biggest slum - now with roads, toilets and wifi

item.title: The immigrant who became a drone firm boss
item.description: The Mexican immigrant who set up the US's largest drone firm

item.title: Can we escape urban commuting hell?
item.description: What tomorrow's urban transport systems might look like

item.title: Go Figure: The week in numbers
item.description: The big numbers from the week's news visualised
